snippet: When The Times believes a subject is worth it, it pulls out all the stops. But is there such a thing as too much?
abstract: Margaret Sullivan The Public Editor column examines whether The New York Times goes too far when it decides to put its full weight behind a topic, such as legalization of marijuana.
lead_paragraph: When The Times believes a subject is worth it, it pulls out all the stops. But is there such a thing as too much?

headline.seo: Public Editor on Marijuana Editorials and Campus Assault Accusation
headline.main: The Times and the ‘Go Big’ Approach
headline.print_headline: The Times and the ‘Go Big’ Approach
